citation.title: Crystal structure of the TPR domain of kinesin light chain 1.

reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.8 ANGSTROMS) OF 205-497

comment.text: Kinesin is a microtubule-associated force-producing protein that may play a role in organelle transport. The light chain may function in coupling of cargo to the heavy chain or in the modulation of its ATPase activity.

Oligomeric complex composed of two heavy chains and two light chains. Interacts with SPAG9. Interacts with ATCAY; may link mitochondria to KLC1 and regulate mitochondria localization into neuron projections (By similarity). Interacts (via TPR repeats) with TOR1A; the interaction associates TOR1A with the kinesin oligomeric complex (PubMed:14970196). Interacts with BORCS5 (PubMed:25898167). Interacts with MAPK8IP3/JIP3 and NTRK2/TRKB; interaction with NTRK2/TRKB is mediated by MAPK8IP3/JIP3 (By similarity).
(Microbial infection) Interacts with adenovirus hexon-interlacing protein; this interaction leads to capsid disruption at the nuclear pore complex during virus entry into host cell.
Additional isoforms seem to exist. Has the potential to produce 285'919 splice forms.
Found in a variety of tissues. Mostly abundant in brain and spine.
Belongs to the kinesin light chain family.
It is uncertain whether Met-1 or Met-5 is the initiator.

property.value: Expressed in Brodmann (1909) area 9 and 241 other tissues
P:antigen processing and presentation of exogenous peptide antigen via MHC class II
P:retrograde vesicle-mediated transport, Golgi to endoplasmic reticulum

feature.description: In isoform G, isoform N and isoform S.
In isoform C and isoform S.
In isoform J, isoform K and isoform N.
In isoform J and isoform N.
No effect on motor function; when associated with A/D-524.
No effect on motor function; when associated with A/D-521.
